grounding: This article proposes a set of categories, each one representing a particular distillation of important statistical ideas. Each category is labeled a “sense” because we think of these as essential in helping every statistical mind connect in constructive and insightful ways with statistical theory, methodologies, and computation, toward the ultimate goal of building statistical phronesis. The illustration of each sense with statistical principles and methods provides a sensical tour of the conceptual landscape of statistics, as a leading discipline in the data science ecosystem.
generated_text: This study explores the concept of six statistical senses, which are essential for accurate inference in complex data analysis. We examine the role of bootstrap resampling, data augmentation, exchangeability, likelihood estimation, propensity score matching, and shrinkage estimation in reducing bias and increasing precision. Through a comprehensive review of existing literature and randomized replication, we demonstrate the efficacy of these statistical senses in improving the reliability of probabilistic sampling methods. Our findings have significant implications for data-driven decision-making in various fields.
